etymology.description: 嘗/尝 (taste; sample) + 試/试 (test; examine) = try; attempt
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of tasting with testing, emphasizing an initial or exploratory effort to see if something works. Common for trying methods, tasks, or approaches before committing.
etymology.simplification: Both characters were simplified to reduce stroke count and speed writing: 嘗→尝 by compressing interior components; 試→试 by changing 言 to 讠 and simplifying the right-side phonetic.

examples.chinese: 我想尝试这个方法(我想嘗試這個方法)。
examples.english: I want to try this method.

examples.chinese: 我们先尝试小规模测试，再决定下一步(我們先嘗試小規模測試，再決定下一步)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen xiān chángshì xiǎo guīmó cèshì, zài juédìng xià yī bù.
examples.english: We will first try a small-scale test, then decide the next step.

examples.chinese: 面对新的挑战，他愿意尝试不同的方法(面對新的挑戰，他願意嘗試不同的方法)。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì xīn de tiǎozhàn, tā yuànyì chángshì bùtóng de fāngfǎ.
examples.english: Facing new challenges, he is willing to try different approaches.
